name: Ahu-Nixta
movement: fly 30 ft., swim 30 ft., walk 30 ft.
description: The Ahu-Nixta is a large aberration encased in clockwork armor, resembling a shapeless mass with appendages and manipulators for combat and interaction. It has an eerie presence and its clockwork armor enhances its capabilities.
memorable: Unique blend of mechanical prowess and unsettling magical abilities, capable of shifting from a formidable opponent to a vulnerable entity when it exits its armor.
goals: To engage in combat, manipulate its environment, and cast spells to control its foes.
relations: Can potentially be found with other mechanical or aberrant creatures.
environment: Typically found in areas conducive to its nature, possibly ruins or ancient sites.
strengths: Possesses damage immunities, spellcasting abilities, and a versatile attack strategy.
weaknesses: Significantly weakened without its clockwork armor, losing many of its defensive and offensive capabilities.
attacks: Multiattack capability with three melee attacks or casting at-will spells, featuring Whirring Blades, Pronged Scepter, and Bashing Rod for effective damage.
most_powerful_ability: Clockwork Encasement allows it to switch between forms and protect itself while in armor; Immutable Form prevents form alteration while armored.
senses: The Ahu-Nixta has an above-average perception with a skill of +3.
skills: Boasts a skill proficiency in perception, indicating above-average awareness.
additional_information: Immunities to poison and psychic damage, along with various conditions.
At-will spells include fear, fire bolt, and telekinesis, allowing for versatile combat options.
The innate spellcasting ability is governed by Intelligence, leading to strong spell effects.
Can exit or enter its clockwork armor as a bonus action.
Features a pulpy mass that can form appendages for manipulation without combat.
spellcasting: Innate spellcasting capability allows it to cast various spells at will without material components.
